item.title: Extended Clockwork Revolution Showcase Highlights Action, RPG Mechanics, Time Manipulation, And More
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/xbox-games-showcase/2025/06/08/extended-clockwork-revolution-showcase-highlights-action-rpg

Today’s Xbox Games Showcase came with a new and extended video highlighting Clockwork Revolution from inXile Entertainment. The game was first announced at this same Xbox Games Showcase back in 2023, but today’s presentation offered a much deeper look at what we can expect. 

In Clockwork Revolution, players take on the role of a customized character named Morgan Vanette, who lives in a seemingly steampunk-inspired alternate history of 1895, in the city of Avalon in a neighborhood called The Tangle. Part of a gang known as the Rotten Row Hooligans, Morgan navigates a world populated both by people and clockwork individuals, and some that seem halfway between the two. 

Gameplay shows off plenty of sneaking and combat, as well as some extensive customization tools for both character visuals and weapons. But the most intriguing gameplay shows off special time powers that let Morgan do things like rewind time, rebuild destroyed structures, slow down enemy bullets, and in a larger sense, rewrite the flow of history.

There’s no word yet on when we can expect Clockwork Revolution to arrive, but the game is targeting a launch on Xbox Series X/S and PC.

item.title: Pokémon Developer Game Freak Announces Beast Of Reincarnation For PS5, Xbox, And PC
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/xbox-games-showcase/2025/06/08/pokemon-developer-game-freak-announces-beast-of-reincarnation-for

Game Freak previously teased a game called Project Bloom, and during today's Xbox Games Showcase, the Pokémon developer revealed the final title as Beast of Reincarnation. In addition to a multiplatform release, we also learned it will be on Xbox Game Pass at launch.

In this title, you step into the shoes of Emma the Sealer as you navigate a post-apocalyptic Japan. Along with her dog, Koo, she'll work to find the source of corruption and save humanity from extinction. Beast of Reincarnation is directed by Kota Furushima, who worked on the battle system of Pokémon Ultra Sun & Ultra Moon and Pokémon Sword & Shield, as well as the sound of Pokémon Legends: Arceus and Pokémon Scarlet & Violet.

"It's incredible to be working with game director Furushima-san and the renowned development team at Game Freak," executive producer at publisher Fictions Mika Kurasawa said in a press release. "We are so excited to show players a glimpse into the stunning world and intense combat of Beast of Reincarnation."

Beast of Reincarnation arrives on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC in 2026. You can see the full reveal trailer below.

item.title: Mudang: Two Hearts Is A Political Action Thriller Set In Near-Future Korea
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/xbox-games-showcase/2025/06/08/mudang-two-hearts-is-a-political-action-thriller-set-in-near-future

Revealed during the Xbox Games Showcase, Mudang: Two Hearts is a stealth action game that imagines a near future where North and South Korea are set to reunite when a terrorist group attacks the South Korean National Assembly.

Developer EVR Studio describes Mudang as a tactical stealth game. The trailer for the game shows off impressive performance capture and violent action.

The game will apparently follow two primary characters. Ji Jeongtae is an elite North Korean special forces operative and GAVI is a K-pop idol living under constant surveillance who is key to uncovering a conspiracy about how the government is manipulating and taking advantage of the population's emotions.

Mudang: Two Hearts is coming to Xbox platforms in 2026.

item.title: Gorgeous 2D adventure Planet of Lana is getting a sequel
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/gorgeous-2d-adventure-planet-of-lana-is-getting-a-sequel

Planet of Lana is getting a sequel called Children of the Leaf and it's due out next year.

A continuation of the 2023 game's gorgeous 2D world, players will once again take the role of Lana and her adorable companion Mui as they navigate a strange world after a robot invasion.

The game will be released across Xbox Series X/S, PC, PS4, PS5, and Nintendo Switch in 2026, arriving on Game Pass day one.

"In the past few years, we've been honoured to see how Planet of Lana has touched players worldwide, from its cinematic world to its heartwarming story and action-packed gameplay," said Adam Stjärnljus, creative director at developer Wishfully.

"Our team learned a lot from creating the first game and we always knew that Lana and Mui's story wasn't over, so we've created a whole new adventure for players, packed with creative puzzle sequences and surprises around every corner. We can't wait for players to join our dynamic duo once again, and unravel the mysteries of Novo's world."

The sequel promises more clever puzzle solving, as well as refined stealth mechanics, new agility-challenging action sequences, and a profound sci-fi story.

The original Planet of Lana received a positive reaction on its release. "A beautifully crafted side-scroller with a restless puzzle imagination," reads our Planet of Lana review.

item.title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 gets pre-order exclusive demo and a Ninja Turtle
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/tony-hawks-pro-skater-3-4-gets-pre-order-exclusive-demo-and-a-ninja-turtle

With its 11th July release date closing in, Activision has announced a Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 demo, but it's a pre-order exclusive, making it the opposite of 'try before you buy'.

As we learned previously, Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 is a ground-up remake of the beloved skating games, and brings a range of "modern upgrades" - including "new skaters, gnarlier tricks, an even sicker soundtrack", alongside new parks (a water park, pinball table, and movie studio are confirmed), plus cross-platform online multiplayer for up to eight skaters.

Multiplayer includes the new HAWK mode, which sees players dropping letters in hard-to-find spots then racing to find as many as they can within the time limit. There's also the sandbox-y Free Skate mode, plus a range of different activities within the Competitive playlist: Trick Attack, Score Challenge, Combo Mambo, Combo Challenge, and Graffiti.

As for Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4's expanded playable roster, it now includes Rayssa Leal, Chloe Covell, Zion Wright, Jamie Foy, Nora Vasconcellos, Margielyn Didal, Yuto Horigome, Zion Wright, Aurélien Giraud, and Andy Anderson. Additionally, there's an appearance from the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle's Michelangelo, who arrives as an unlockable "secret" skater.

Actvision has also confirmed the return of Create-A-Skater, alongside an upgraded version Create-A-Park, which introduces new props - including speed boost pads and musical notes - and the ability to add custom goals. Players fond of documenting their skating highlights can also make use of a new photo mode.

Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 will be available for PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Switch, PC, and Game Pass when it launches on 11th July, with a Switch 2 release date to be announced "later".

As for that demo, it's out today on Xbox, PlayStation, and PC, and features the Foundry and College parks, skaters Tony Hawk and Rayssa Leal, plus a limited selection of songs. However, you'll need to pre-order the full game in order to access it.

item.title: Xbox just announced their first ever handhelds – the ROG Xbox Ally and Ally X
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/06/08/xbox-just-announced-their-first-ever-handhelds-the-rog-xbox-ally-and-ally-x/

The Sunday of not-E3 is renowned as Microsoft’s time to shine. It’s fair to say that recent years haven’t quite set hearts racing, no matter how good Xbox output like Indiana Jones and the Great Circle and Avowed have been, so it’s a welcome surprise to find that Xbox haven’t just rolled out a few smart-looking trailers, with the earth-shattering announcement that they’re set to release the very first Xbox handheld. It’s not even just one, with the ROG Xbox Ally and the ROG Xbox Ally X providing two different tiers of Xbox handheld. This is a great day for Xbox gamers.

The quickest among you will note that the ROG Ally is a thing that already exists. ROG’s Ally, and it’s more powerful follow-up the Ally X, are PC handhelds that have spent the last few years competing with Valve’s Steam Deck for portable PC gamers’ hearts. There’s a very strong argument to say that they’re the better option, though they’ve been hamstrung by Microsoft’s own Windows platform which was never made specifically for a handheld format.

The ROG Xbox Ally and ROG Xbox Ally X are the best of both worlds, the partnership between the two companies giving you access to your entire Xbox library as well as opening up the world of PC gaming to you as well, including all of the PC based stores like Steam and the Epic Game Store.

The Xbox Ally and Ally X have had some obvious physical changes made to them over ROGs older versions of the Ally, most noticeably in the extended, and presumably far more ergonomic hand grips. The Steam Deck’s comfort levels were the last bastion of defence that Steam Deck owners had over Ally owners, and we can’t wait to see if the Xbox Ally and Ally X trounce them, becoming the most comfortable PC handheld out there.

They’ve got some pretty impressive specs under the hood. Both have AMD processors, with the Xbox Ally toting an AMD Ryzen Z2 A Processor, alongside 16GB of RAM and a 512GD SSD. The Xbox Ally X meanwhile has a Ryzen AI Z2 Extreme processor as well as a massive 24GB of RAM and 1TB of storage. They’re both going to be serious gaming machines – the original Ally has been a fantastic option, with a less powerful chipset, so we can’t wait to see how the new pair will perform.

Both have 7″ 1080p full HD screens, with a 120Hz refresh rate, and Freesync Premium onboard, which should mean everything will look super smooth and bright.

item.title: Ambrosia Sky Preview - Fighting Against Fungus
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/previews/ambrosia-sky-preview-fighting-against-fungus

There's just something so satisfying about cleaning up a mess -- provided it's in a video game. Real-life messes are no fun, but for some reason, power-washing that house is just too satisfying. The upcoming Ambrosia Sky provides that same satisfaction, but with a deadly twist.

Indeed, usually nothing is fighting back against you as you clean, but in Ambrosia Sky, a deadly fungus seeks you out. A so-called first-person, immersive "clean 'em up" from developer Soft Rains, Ambrosia Sky's fungal foe is truly terrifying.

It's Time for Cleanup 

Let's set the stage. It's far into the future and you're a "Scarab," essentially an undertaker that helps the deceased pass on. She's also something of a space "disaster specialist," armed with tools to clean up the contamination.

We begin the demo in a space station. The aim is to find a body and help it pass on, but this fungus is everywhere. Working our way through the space station, going past deadly fungus some of it is electric, and other variants literally seek you out.

This is where Ambrosia Sky really impressed me. This fungus is forming around you quickly, and it's so fast that you become surrounded. Just seeing this amalgamation build up around you is an impressive technical feat.

Not only that, it's how you can clean up this fungus that is equally impressive. Soft Rains has developed a technology called "Quantized Impact Field." It's a mouthful, but hey, it works quite well. 

The fungus are voxels, but the tech hides it very well. Cleaning the fungus with various sprays at your disposal break it down; in other words, volumetric cleaning. 

Spray it All Away

The sprayer you have is a cool tool. Like I said, cleaning is satisfying, and so is spraying down the fungus and having it crumble away. There are various sprays, like the basic, which is great for cleaning, but also others like fire and electric.

Fire can spread, by the way, and I haven't found a good use for it yet. Electric spray, on the other hand, allows players to activate doors without a direct line to power. Shoot spray at the top of the door and keep spraying until it hits an active power source, and there you go, it's on!

You can also change the nozzle, so the spray can go straight, vertical, or horizontal. In one segment, the gravity in the space station is turned off. Because of that, the spray no longer arcs due to gravity and allows you to clean all the more effectively.

Ambrosia Sky Preview | Final Thoughts

It's also worth nothing, the developers aren't necessarily aiming for a highly detailed art style, but the Quantized Impact Field makes up for a lot of it. Combined with excellent use of lighting, Ambrosia Sky is a promising game.

While it'll likely take several more years to develop, a demo is available today on Steam, so if cleaning up some deadly shrooms tickles your fancy, check it out!

item.title: Gears of War: E-Day is coming in 2026
item.content:encoded:
https://www.theverge.com/news/682283/gears-of-war-e-day-release-date-2026

Tom Warren is a senior editor and author of Notepad, who has been covering all things Microsoft, PC, and tech for over 20 years.

Microsoft first revealed Gears of War: E-Day during its Xbox Games Showcase last year, and at today’s showcase it’s now putting a 2026 release window on the latest entry in the sci-fi shooter series. Developed by The Coalition, E-Day will release in a year that marks 20 years since the original Gears of War game debuted on the Xbox 360, and 25 years of Xbox.

E-Day is set 14 years before the first Gears game, and “tells the story of the first Locust emergence on Sera.” It’s being billed as an origin story, and once again stars Marcus Fenix. E-Day is the first title in the series since Gears 5 debuted in 2019.

Last month, Microsoft also announced a Gears of War remaster that also brings the franchise to PlayStation for the first time. Gears of War: Reloaded is launching on August 26th for Xbox Series X / S, PlayStation, and PC for $39.99. The remaster features 4K resolution, 120fps support, and cross-progression and cross-play for all platforms. Gears of War: Reloaded will also have two-player co-op for the campaign and 8-player multiplayer.

Xbox chief Phil Spencer confirmed the E-Day release window during the Xbox Games Showcase earlier today, and also revealed “the next Forza” is coming in 2026 too, as well as “the return of a classic that’s been with us since the beginning.” That classic may well be the Halo CE remaster I wrote about last year.

item.title: Mudang: Two Hearts is a stealth action thriller, like Splinter Cell with K-pop and rage zombies
item.content:encoded:
https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/mudang-two-hearts-is-a-stealth-action-thriller-like-splinter-cell-with-k-pop-and-rage-zombies

Ubisoft are nowhere to be found during this year's not-E3 season, meaning there's no opportunity for the French publisher to announce six new games they'll never release. I still crave a Splinter Cell fix, however, and Mudang: Two Hearts delivered, kinda. It's Korean, it's got fast-moving rage zombies, but it's also got men shimmying up pipes, cinematic brawls, and a rapid-cut montage of knife crimes. You should watch the trailer.

"In the not-too-distant future, the divided nations of South and North Korea are on the verge of reunification," begins the game's blurb. "On the day when the historic bill was set to pass, a mystery terrorist group attacks the South Korean National Assembly, throwing the entire nation into chaos. Sent to uncover the truth, a North Korean soldier stumbles upon a K-Pop star and is given a new mission: protect the girl who can unravel it all."

Hard to say which part of that seems less realistic, but the important thing is it's described as a stealth action thriller. Whether I'm a Fisherlike or a K-pop star, all I want to do is shimmy along ledges and press some QTE prompts during hand-to-hand combat with a man whose head is magnetically drawn towards the nearest mirror.

That's about all we know for now, but Mudang will apparently launch sometime in 2026.

item.title: Super Meat Boy 3D will give the bloody mascot a new dimension in 2026
item.content:encoded:
https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/super-meat-boy-3d-will-give-the-bloody-mascot-a-new-dimension-in-2026

A 3D sequel to the masochistic 2010 platformer Super Meat Boy was announced at the Xbox showcase. It's simply called Super Meat Boy 3D and it basically looks exactly how you'd expect in the trailer below.

Note to meat marketers: the green pipe fakeout only works for anyone watching the showcase live. Everyone else knows this is about the little bleedy guy by the time they click on the video. But good effort.

As you can see, the trailer shows a lot of bear traps, chainsaws, sawblades, lasers, slime blocks, molten steel, and angry robots. I can't really stand a 3D platformer, to be frank. Not since Gex. But I'm sure plenty of Super Meat Stans will get stuck in.

A sequel to the original platformer, Super Meat Boy Forever, was released in 2020 but it was an auto-runner and maybe didn't hit the previous game's sweet spot of tough-but-fair fatality that some precision platforming nerds loved. This sequel is made by the same studio, Team Meat, but the original developer of the little red eejit, Edmund McMillen, is off making something else entirely: an "endless cat-breeding RPG" called Mewgenics. Checks out.

item.title: Phil Spencer Just Lowkey Confirmed The Halo: Combat Evolved Remaster Making 2026 A Massive Year For Xbox
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/xbox-showcase-halo-ce-remaster-forza-horizon-6-gears-1851784012

What might have been the biggest news of the Xbox summer showcase didn’t come in the form of a surprise trailer but rather straight from the mouth of Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer. While there was no footage to debut, the executive quietly let slip that a new Forza is coming next year as well as the “return of a classic” that’s been with Xbox from the beginning. It’s hard to imagine that’s anything other than the previously reported Halo: Combat Evolved remaster.

Suggested Reading

Halo’s Joseph Morgan On Playing Nuanced Characters And The Flaws of Season 1

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

“As we think about bringing a new generation of players to these iconic franchises I’m excited to share that players will get to celebrate 25 years of Xbox with a new Fable, the next Forza, Gears of War: E-Day, and the return of a classic that’s been with us since the beginning,” Spencer said near the end of the livestream.

That tiny, innocuous-sounding snippet was full of news. The Gears of War prequel didn’t previously have a release window and the newest Forza hadn’t previously been mentioned at all (will it be Forza Horizon 6 or something else?) But the detail most fans will be glomming onto is the hint at the original Halo’s return.

That game, previously reported by The Verge’s Tom Warren to be a remaster of Halo: Combat Evolved in Unreal Engine 5, will presumably follow in the footsteps of the recent remaster of The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion, which Microsoft shadow-dropped last month. If that ends up being the case, the Halo remaster will likely be the original game running with overhauled graphics and some tweaked systems, though unlike Oblivion, there is already an HD Master Chief Collection players can use to access Bungie’s hit 2001 shooter. We’ll have to wait to learn more to see if Combat Evolved gets a more fundamental reworking to make it stand out on modern platforms.

Whatever it ends up being, it’s almost a guaranteed thing that a Halo remaster will be coming to PlayStation 5 as well, potentially serving as the perfect starting point to bring the iconic Xbox exclusive to Sony’s console for the first time ever.

And while that multiplatform push has left some fans wondering why they bothered buying an Xbox console at all this generation, Spencer’s last-minute sound-bite suggests next year will be full of nostalgia for those who have been with the platform for decades. All of the core, previously exclusive franchises will be there, and playable on Microsoft’s new Xbox-branded ROG Ally PC gaming handheld to boot.

item.title: Moomintroll: Winter’s Warmth announced for consoles, PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/moomintroll-winters-warmth-announced-for-consoles-pc

Hyper Games has announced Moomintroll: Winter’s Warmth, a cozy, story-rich adventure game and follow-up to Snufkin: Melody of Moominvalley. It will be available for unspecified consoles and PC via Steam in 2026.

“We’re so excited to finally be able to share this news with our community and fans across the world,” said Hyper Games CEO Are Sundnes in a press release. “It’s been incredibly difficult to keep this secret while working on the game for over two years now. Also proud and honored to be trusted by the owners of Moomin to let gamers revisit the wonderful Moominvalley and all of its inhabitants.”

Moomin Characters managing director Roleff Krakstrom added, “We are thrilled about the success of Snufkin: Melody of Moominvalley and the brilliant way the Hyper Games team has interpreted Tove Jansson’s stories for gamers worldwide. It is very exciting that they have decided to embark on their second Moomin adventure, with Moomintroll in the lead role. Hyper Games has been a close collaborator with us for half a decade, and we have no doubt that they will create yet another magical experience that Moomin fans will love.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via Hyper Games:

About

From the creators of Snufkin: Melody of Moominvalley comes a heartwarming new adventure inspired by the beloved Moomin stories by Tove Jansson. This time, join Moomintroll himself on a charming but cold winter journey.

When Moomintroll unexpectedly wakes up early from his winter hibernation, he finds himself completely alone for the first time, in a world he barely recognizes. The familiar landscape of Moominvalley is now cloaked in the frosty veil of the Lady of the Cold. Initially seeking someone to care for him and longing to banish winter, young Moomintroll reluctantly embarks on a journey into the unknown, learning to forge new friendships and help those in greater need than himself.

Moomintroll: Winter’s Warmth is a story-driven, cozy puzzle adventure that lets you return to the enchanting Moominvalley through the creative lens of the award-winning indie studio Hyper Games. While not a direct sequel to Snufkin: Melody of Moominvalley, it is a spiritual successor with many similarities. You can enjoy both games on their own, and in any order you’d like.

Key Features

  • Third-Person, Top-Down Adventure – Explore Moominvalley and enjoy the beautiful winter landscape.
  • Story-Driven Exploration – Discover the warmth of winter with Moomintroll.
  • A Winter Wonderland – Inspired by Tove Jansson’s Moominland Midwinter.
  • Play as Moomintroll – Everyone’s favorite Moomin on a quest for warmth and friendship.
  • Environmental Puzzles – Set in beautifully crafted, cozy surroundings.

item.title: Planet of Lana II: Children of the Leaf announced for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/planet-of-lana-ii-children-of-the-leaf-announced-for-ps5-xbox-series-ps4-xbox-one-switch-and-pc

Publisher Thunderful Games and developer Wishfully have announced Planet of Lana II: Children of the Leaf for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC (Steam, Microsoft Store). It will launch in 2026. It will also be available via Game Pass.

“In the past few years, we’ve been honored to see how Planet of Lana has touched players worldwide, from its cinematic world to its heartwarming story and action-packed gameplay,” said Wishfully creative director Adam Stjarnljus in a press release. “Our team learned a lot from creating the first game and we always knew that Lana and Mui’s story wasn’t over, so we’ve created a whole new adventure for players, packed with creative puzzle sequences and surprises around every corner. We can’t wait for players to join our dynamic duo once again, and unravel the mysteries of Novo’s world.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

About

After saving their planet from an invading Robot army, Lana and Mui continue to uncover its mysterious past. The question is: Are they ready for the truth? Pass through icy mountains, deep oceans and forgotten ruins in this cinematic adventure. Unravel a deeper, longer story, tougher challenges, and an unbreakable bond.

The saga continues. Their home saved, a deeper journey begins.

Embark on an unforgettable cinematic puzzle journey with Lana and her loyal companion Mui. Whether you’re a returning hero or a new adventurer, step into a world where a new, ancient mystery emerges from Novo’s hidden depths. But as they scour these depths, a new threat will put their unbreakable bond to the ultimate test, guiding Lana to confront her destiny amidst encroaching shadows.

Planet of Lana II: Children of the Leaf is a cinematic puzzle adventure framed by an epic science-fiction saga that stretches across centuries and galaxies.

Key Features

  • Unique, Evolved Companion Gameplay – Experience Lana and Mui’s profound, evolving bond. Guide Mui with enhanced precision for deep exploration and collaborative puzzle-solving.
  • Solve Diverse and Clever Puzzles – Tackle a wider array of physics-based puzzles, including hypnotizing spectacular creatures and controlling new hybrid robots for unique solutions.
  • Master Stealth and Wit – Carefully navigate dangerous situations using refined stealth mechanics and tactical wit to outsmart foes.
  • Survive Challenging Action Sequences – Use your reflexes and master Lana’s new agility with wall jumps, run-slides, and faster movement to survive thrilling, dynamic action sequences.
  • Discover an Epic and Deeper Story – Immerse in a longer, more profound science-fiction saga. Confront Lana’s own demons and unveil the planet’s darkest secrets across stunning, diverse worlds, including new underwater chapters.
  • Return of an Acclaimed Composer – Experience Takeshi Furukawa’s critically acclaimed score, from the original Planet of Lana. His mesmerizing compositions seamlessly elevate every emotional beat and cinematic moment.

item.title: DON’T NOD announces sci-fi action adventure game Aphelion for PS5, Xbox Series, and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/dont-nod-announces-sci-fi-action-adventure-game-aphelion-for-ps5-xbox-series-and-pc

DON’T NOD has announced Aphelion, a cinematic science-fiction third-person action adventure game coming to PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store in 2026. It will also be available via Game Pass. The game is being made in collaboration with the European Space Agency.

“Aphelion is a game we’re very passionate about, something we’re really pushing ourselves creatively on,” said creative director Florent Guillaume in a press release. “We’re excited to share more of DON’T NOD’s first human story in space, and to be able to do it in collaboration with the European Space Agency is incredibly exciting and special for us.”

European Space Agency partnership and brand licensing officer Nadia Luders added, “For fifty years, ESA has combined rigorous space science with the boundless imagination of science fiction to explore solutions to our planet’s greatest challenges. Aphelion captures that spirit—where research meets imaginative vision – to inspire the next generation to carry Europe’s space ambition into the future.”

Here is an overview of the game, via DON’T NOD:

About

Stranded on a frozen planet, astronaut Ariane must brave rugged landscapes and shifting realities to rescue her wounded partner, Thomas. This action-packed science-fiction adventure blends exploration, traversal, and tense stealth gameplay.

A Science-Fiction Action Adventure on the Edge of Our Solar System

By 2060, Earth will be uninhabitable. The discovery of a 9th planet – Persephone – at the edge of the solar system, is humanity’s best hope. The European Space Agency is dispatching the Hope 01 scientific mission, consisting of 2 of their accomplished astronauts, Ariane and Thomas. Their mission: to survey the planet and determine whether humanity can prosper anew here.

Your adventure begins in chaos, as the crash landing of their ship scatters them across the planet, launching them on a desperate quest to find one another.

Aphelion is a cinematic third-person action-adventure set on the planet Persephone, an uncharted, frozen world. Stranded and isolated, you must survive the truly unknown, find each other, and complete the mission. Traverse stunning alien landscapes, avoid lurking threats, and discover the haunting secrets buried beneath the ice.

Explore an Uncharted Planet

Explore the surreal beauty of Persephone, a vast frozen world shaped by deadly weather and ever-changing terrain.

Armed only with your explorational tools—pathfinder, oxygen tank, grappling hook, and more—you must face the unknown, traverse treacherous terrain, and gather clues about the strange, reality-bending phenomenon threatening your existence.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Find Each Other

Helpless on the edge of the solar system, the Hope 01 crew faces a brutal new world and the echoes of a complicated past. Ariane Montclair and Thomas Cross share a deep connection, a relationship left unresolved by the demands of their careers and their mission. Facing overwhelming odds, their fractured bond becomes a lifeline as they grasp in the dark for one another.

Hide to Survive

You’re not alone. Something lurks beneath the ice.

Key Features

  • A realistic depiction of space exploration.
  • An emotional drama on an alien world.
  • Cinematic action-adventure with gripping traversal gameplay.
  • Tools-based exploration and survival.
  • Tense and exciting stealth-based sequences.

item.title: Xbox Boss Teases 2026 Plans, Including Possible Halo Release
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/xbox-boss-teases-2026-plans-including-possible-halo-release/1100-6532264/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

As the end of Microsoft's Xbox Games Showcase, Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer teased the company's plans for 2026, which marks the 25th anniversary of Xbox.

Spencer said Gears of War: E-Day, the new Fable, and the next Forza game will launch in 2026. He also teased the "return of a classic that's been with us since the beginning."

Many are taking that to be a reference to the Halo franchise. Microsoft is working on multiple new Halo games, one of which could be a remaster of 2001's Halo: Combat Evolved. It was previously reported that a remaster of the first Halo game was in the works and might also come to PS5.

In 2024, Microsoft announced that it was working on new Halo games and that the franchise was shifting from using the company's own game engine to Epic's Unreal Engine. As part of this, Microsoft also changed the name of 343 Industries to Halo Studios.

Fable, Forza, Gears, and Halo are some of the most iconic and recognizable Xbox brands, and all four franchises coming out in 2026 to celebrate the franchise's 25th anniversary could be a big moment.

As for what Microsoft has on tap for 2025, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 is on the way from Activision, as is The Outer Worlds 2 from Obsidian. While fans have to wait until 2026 for Gears of War: E-Day, the Gears of War 1 Reloaded remaster is releasing this August.

item.title: Sea Of Thieves Season 17 Introduces Smugglers Faction And New Loot
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/sea-of-thieves-season-17-introduces-smugglers-faction-and-new-weapons/1100-6532263/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Season 17 of Rare's online pirate title Sea of Thieves was announced at the Xbox Games Showcase, and it'll add a mischievous new faction to the game's sandbox called The Smuggler's League. The upcoming season, titled Smugglers' Tide, begins in August and includes new Voyages and some of the most powerful explosives in the game.

Judging from the trailer, The Smuggler's League is all about, well, smuggling loot, salvaging treasure and other goodies from sunken ships or stealing them from other players. Some of the new loot showcased in the trailer includes crates filled with golden bottles and black gunpowder barrels, which will most certainly explode if mishandled, but players can weaponize their explosive capabilities.

Watch the trailer below.

The trailer showcases characters using harpoon guns to snag loot and employing stealth tactics to make off with explosive barrels. While the trailer doesn't go into detail about faction-specific rewards, expect to earn several exclusive cosmetics for completing Smuggler's Voyages and commendations.

The current season of the one-of-a-kind Sea of Thieves, titled Reapers Rule, began on May 22, adding new content for The Reaper's Bones faction. The season also added a new Voyage, the ability to summon NPC skeletons to assist your crew, and a portable cannon called the Cannon of Rage.

Rare is also developing a title called Everwild, but the game was a no-show at this year's Xbox Games Showcase.

item.title: Keeper Is The New Double Fine Adventure, And It Looks Wild
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/keeper-is-the-new-double-fine-adventure-and-it-looks-wild/1100-6532262/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Keeper, the newest game from acclaimed adventure-game developers Double Fine and veteran designer Lee Petty, was revealed at the Xbox Games Showcase. As the name implies, the game involves a moving lighthouse--though whether you're playing and the lighthouse or a being managing it (a "keeper") isn't quite clear. A green bird appears frequently alongside the lighthouse, seeming to aid and guide the lighthouse as it travels through a variety of colorful environments including gemstone-adorned caves, treacherous cliffsides, ancient ruins, and a desolate plain. The bird also seems to be important for solving puzzles, as the trailer demonstrates.

We also get a brief look at some very large beings that could either be mechanical monstrosities or organic giants. How the lighthouse will deal with these obstacles, or if they're even threats at all, remains unclear. Keeper will release on Xbox Series X and PC on October 17, 2025.

item.title: Super Meat Boy 3D Places The Eponymous Meat Pile In A 3D Platformer
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/xbox-games-showcase/2025/06/08/super-meat-boy-3d-places-the-eponymous-meat-pile-in-a-3d-platformer

Super Meat Boy was an early point of success for Xbox Live Arcade. The difficult 2D platformer was a popular game on the platform, and though it has never received a proper numbered sequel, it has been given a few spin-offs like Super Meat Boy Forever and Dr. Fetus' Mean Meat Machine.

Super Meat Boy 3D, however, looks to be its biggest follow-up yet. The game is fully 3D and looks every bit as challenging as the games that preceded it. It also features the ghosts of previous attempts, which is a staple for the series.

The game is apparently being developed by Sluggerfly (Hell Pie), Headup Games (Casual Loop), and Team Meat.

item.title: Everything announced in Microsoft's Xbox Games Showcase
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/xbox-game-showcase-2025-round-up-everything-announced

The Xbox Showcase 2025 has just concluded, and with it a bunch of new reveals and updates for existing Xbox games have just been thrown out for your viewing pleasure. It was a hefty show, with plenty to look over, marking a lot to look out for those Xbox fans out there.

Below, we've covered all the major announcements during the Xbox Showcase, with trailers included alongside every game we saw, so consider this your one-stop-shop for everything we saw during the event! In addition, if you want more info on a particular reveal, we'll link to the dedicated news article within the appropriate section.

The Outer Worlds 2

And we're off! First up is The Outer Worlds 2, which got a new gameplay trailer at the very start of the Xbox Games Showcase. In it, we saw a variety of new locations, rifts that are threatening the colonies, and plenty of anti-capitalist commentary as you'd expect. Plus, plenty of first person shooter action with new weapons and enemies on display. A chunky trailer for a much-anticipated upcoming game.

The Outer Worlds 2 is coming out October 29 2025 on Xbox Series X|S, PC, PS5

High on Life 2

Out first World Premiere! High on Life 2 got a new reveal trailer, showing off a lot of that distinct humour and fast-paced action (although this isn't a gameplay trailer, keep that in mind.)

High on Life 2 is coming this winter to Xbox, PC, and PS5.

Resonance: A Plague Tale Legacy

Next up is Resonance: A Plague Tale Legacy, which got a cinematic reveal trailer. It's coming 2026 to Xbox, PS5, and PC.

ROG Xbox Ally and ROG Xbox Ally X

Now for some hardware! We got our first look at the ROG Xbox Ally and Ally X, handheld consoles! The X has an AMD Ryzen 72 Extreme under the hood 24GB memory and 1TB of storage! On the other hand, the regular version has an AMD Ryzen Z2A, 16GB of memory and 512GB of memory.

Hollow Knight: Silksong still coming out in 2025

Following the handheld reveal, it was stated ON CAMERA and LIVE that Hollow Knight: Silksong is coming out this year.

The Blood of Dawnwalker

Here's something cool! We got a gameplay trailer for The Blood of Dawnwalker! In it we see what the game will actually play like! A visceral action game filled with all manner of vampiric goodness for to gorge yourself on. It's out in 2026 on the Xbox Series X|S, PC, and PS5.

Super Meat Boy 3D

Oh my word! Super Meat Boy 3D just got announced! It's coming in Early 2026 to XBox Series X|S, PS5, and PC.

Ninja Gaiden 4

Finally we got some gameplay for Ninja Gaiden 4! Developed by Platinum Games, we saw all that lovely punchy close quarter combat you'd expect from the developer who made Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance. Loads of lengthy combos, aerial juggles, and bloody action. Lovely!

It's coming on the 21st October, 2025 to Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PC.

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle: The Order of Giants

Here's something interesting for all your spelunkers. Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is getting some story DLC! The Order of Giants is set to release on the 4th September 2025 on Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PC.

Beast of Reincarnation

Beast of Reincarnation was just revealed, a third-person action game where you and your lovely dog take on all manner of giant daunting looking monsters. It's being made by Gamefreak too, which is cool. It's coming in 2026 to Xbox Serie X|S, PS5, and PC.

Clockwork Revolution

Well well well, if it isn't a gameplay trailer for Clockwork Revolution. In this trailer we see a bunch of action, shooting, dialogue, a bit of character customisation, and a whole lot of world building. Clockwork Revolution is set to launch... "in due time".

Grounded 2

Oh this a nice surprise! Grounded 2 has just been revealed with a fun new gameplay trailer! It's coming on the 29th of July, 2025 to Game Preview, on Xbox Series X|S, and PC.

Cronos: The New Dawn

Time to get spooky! Cronos: The New Dawn got a gameplay trailer, showing off some haunting third person survival horror in a sci-fi setting. Looks pretty darn good to me! It's set to launch in Fall 2025 on Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PC.

The Elder Scrolls Online: Seasons of the Worm Cult

An update for you MMO heads out there. The Elder Scrolls Online is getting Seasons of the Worm Cult on the 18th June 2025. Later in October the game's first server-wide event with world changing possibilities will be coming too.

Aphelion

A reveal trailer for Don't Nod's next game is up next. Aphelion is a sci-fi game in which you must survive a dangerous planet you've found yourself marooned on. Looks pretty cool, and Don't Nod have put out some bangers. It's coming in 2026 to Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PC.

No Ghosts at the Grand

Our next world premiere comes via No Ghosts at the Grand, a paranormal village decoration / refurbishing, cleaning game with a mystery at its core. Looks interesting! There's also a talking cat sidekick, which counts for a lot. It's coming in 2026 to Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PC.

Age of Mythology: Retold (Heavenly Spear update)

RTS lovers finally get some attention with Age of Mythology: Retold, which got a new gameplay trailer at the Xbox Games Showcase. A whole new Japanese pantheon is being added to the game with the Heavenly Spear update, which is sure to go down well with those deeply invested.

The Heavenly Spear update will be coming in Fall 2025 to Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PC.

Mudang: Two Hearts

Mudang: Two Hearts got a very intense new trailer reveal, as well as a release window! It's coming in 2026 to Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PC.

Planet of Lana 2: Children of the Leaf

This one is a feast for the eyes. We got a world premiere for Planet of Lana 2: Children of the Leaf, a wonderful looking platformer coming in 2026 to Xbox, PS5, and PC.

Fallout 76: Gone Fission

You love fishing bud? Well, Fallout 76's Gone Fission update will be right up your street! Or river, I suppose. It's available now on Xbox Series X|S, PS5 and PC.

Solo Leveling Arise: Overdrive

If you love modern anime and action games this may be for you. Solo Leveling Arise: Overdrive just got a reveal trailer. It's coming in 2026 to PC.

Animo

Love me a cute game every now and again. If you're the same, then Animo might be one for you! It just got revealed, with a new gameplay trailer, in which you can control various adorable little creatures and take on battles out in the world. Nice! It comes to Xbox Series X|S, and PC in 2026.

Tony Hawk Pro Skater 3+4

Would you look at that, a launch trailer for Tony Hawk Pro Skater 3+4 was shown off by Tony Hawk himself at the Xbox Showcase! Even Bam Margera is there, alongside a bunch of remade maps from the original games. Plus, Doom Guy is a playable character!

You can play the demo today too! If you want the full game's release date, it's dropping on the 11th July, 2025 on Xbox, PlayStation, and PC.

At Fate's End

Another world premiere, and another gorgeous game to look at! At Fate's End was just announced, a lush looking 2D game I'll be keeping an eye on. It's coming out in 2026 to Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PC.

Gears of War: Reloaded

Gears of War: Reloaded, a remake of the original Gears of War with plenty of visual updates and touch ups, is coming out on the 26th August, 2025. It'll be available on the Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PC.

Persona 4 Revival

A blink and you'll miss it reveal of Persona 4 Revival was shown off, with perhaps seven seconds of gameplay. No release date for it, but it's coming to Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PC.

Sea of Thieves season 17: Smugglers Tide

An update for Sea of Thieves was revealed, it's Smugglers Tide. It looks as though in the games 17th season players will be able to get up to no good. Well, more so than usual. It's coming out in August 2025 to Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PC.

Invincible Vs

Out of nowhere comes an Invincible fighting game called Invincible Vs! We get to see a few characters punch it out, blood galore obviously. It's coming out in 2026 to Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PC.

FF7 Remake: Intergrade and Final Fantasy 16 coming to Xbox

FF7 Remake: Intergrade is coming to Xbox this winter, while Final Fantasy 16 is out on Xbox today!

Keeper

A weird one, but weird is good! Keeper is a new open world game in which you control what appears to be a light house with creepy legs carrying it around. It comes out on the 17th October 2025 to Xbox Series X|S and PC.

Phil Spencer says new Fable, Forza, Gears of War: E-Day coming next year. Teases something Halo related

Before the final trailer, Phil Spencer took the stage to thank folks for watching a look to the future. Spencer stated: "Players will get to celebrate 25 years of Xbox with a new Fable, the next Forza, Gears of War: E-Day, and the return of a classic that has been with us since the beginning."

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7

A final reveal for the show comes in the form of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, taking what looks to be a major departure from the realistic approach we've seen all these years. Mason is back, which means T.V static and mind-bending narrative twists. No release date nor window as of yet.

item.title: Pokémon developer Game Freak reveals Beast of Reincarnation at Xbox Games Showcase
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/pokemon-developer-game-freak-reveals-beast-of-reincarnation-at-xbox-games-showcase

Game Freak, the developer of the Pokémon series, has revealed its new game Beast of Reincarnation at today's Xbox Games Showcase.

The game was previously known as Project Bloom and was announced back in 2023 as the developer signed a deal with Private Division.

Now we finally got a look at gameplay with a new trailer ahead of its release next year across Xbox Series X/S, PC, and PS5. It'll also be out on Game Pass on Xbox and PC.

Beast of Reincarnation takes place in a post-apocalyptic Japan as players take the role of Emma the Sealer confronting the source of the world's corruption to save humanity.

The trailer for the action-adventure game showed plenty of third-person combat against giant beasts, as well as exploration and platforming. It certainly has a very unique and intriguing world mixing traditional and sci-fi aesthetics.

The game will be published by Fictions, a new game publisher founded by a collection of game developers.

"It's incredible to be working with game director Furushima-san and the renowned development team at Game Freak. We greatly value their continued collaboration and trust," said Mika Kurasawa, executive producer at Fictions. "We are so excited to show players a glimpse into the stunning world and intense combat of Beast of Reincarnation."

item.title: Double Fine’s new living lighthouse game is Keeper
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/06/08/double-fines-new-living-lighthouse-game-is-keeper/

Coming from Lee Petty and Double Fine, Keeper is a wonderful looking narrative adventure where you play as a lighthouse come to life.

“Keeper is a story told without words”, Double Fine writes in the trailer blurb, “in which a long-forgotten lighthouse is awakened and, joined by a spirited seabird, embarks upon a heartening tale of unlikely companionship and an unexpected journey into realms beyond understanding.”

It honestly looks delightful with all the charm that you would expect from Double Fine. The Lighthouse reassembles itself after falling over in a storm, forming legs for itself and then scrambling crab-like across the land. The rickety structure is full of personality, and can look and shine light from its top. It also makes friends with a seabird who wants to come along for the ride.

Keeper is in development for Xbox Series X|S, PC and will on Xbox Game Pass on day one, the game launching on 17th October.

This is the first game from Double Fine since Psychonauts 2, which I handed a fantastic 9/10 back in 2021. Is said, “A decade and a half on from the original, Psychonauts 2 is a worthy successor to Double Fine’s cult classic. The platforming and combat gameplay is tighter, the world design is as varied and inventive as ever, and while the story is full of twists, turns and comedic moment, there’s also a wonderful sense of empathy and tenderness throughout. Simply put, Psychonauts 2 has been worth the wait.”

item.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 7 Announced, Will Arrive Later In 2025 On Current And Last-Gen Consoles
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/call-of-duty-black-ops-7-announced-will-arrive-later-in-2025-and-is-still-launching-on-last-gen-consoles/

Closing out the Xbox Games Showcase 2025 was the reveal of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, a sequel to last year's Black Ops 6, due out sometime later this year, set over four decades into the future after the events of the last campaign.

All we got was a teaser trailer and the reveal that this year's Call of Duty is once again a new Black Ops title, but one notable fact missing in the teaser is that Call of Duty is, for at least another year, still launching on PlayStation 4 and Xbox One. Of course, it'll also launch on PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC.

Black Ops 7 is also the latest Call of Duty to add some celebrity star-power to its cast, with Milo Ventimiglia as David Mason, the game's protagonist. While the teaser doesn't show any gameplay or reveal any hints as to what's changing in this year's Call of Duty game, it does make it clear that the campaign will lean more into the fantastical, similar to what players saw in Black Ops 6.

"Our official teaser sets the tone for players to embrace the madness that's incoming with Black Ops 7's story," Activision's head of publishing and marketing, Tyler Bahl, told Windows Central in an interview.

"Delivering consecutive Black Ops games also allows our teams the tremendous opportunity to tap not only into our own creativity but also embrace the shift from a '90s setting to the new 2035 future setting within our marketing."

One interesting bit revealed in an Xbox Wire post following the showcase is that the campaign will be playable entirely in co-op, and that it's once again Raven Software behind the campaign mode.

While Raven Software is leading up the campaign, the game's development is primarily being led by Treyarch. Though, as is the case with all Call of Duty games, several of the studios under Activision will be working on Black Ops 7.

This teaser was just the beginning of what will surely be a massive marketing campaign for Black Ops 7, with more to come later this summer. "The full reveal of Black Ops 7 is coming later this summer, so the community should be on the lookout for teases, clues, and the surprises that the Black Ops series is known for," Bahl said in the same aforementioned interview. "It's an exciting time as we prepare for a new Call of Duty reveal, and the next great experience to come."

item.title: Xbox Games Showcase 2025 - All the News and Announcements
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/xbox-games-showcase-2025-all-news-and-announcements

Today, Xbox held its annual Xbox Games Showcase, and it contained glimpses of what lies in store for Xbox fans around the world. Here's everything that was announced during the show!

The Outer Worlds 2 release date revealed

The show kicked off with a release date for The Outer Worlds 2, as well as a new look at the setting of Obsidian's new action RPG. It all looks very wacky and very satirical, just like the first game. This one's launching on October 29th.

High on Life 2 has more crazy talking weapons and colorful action

Next up, Squanch Games announced High on Life 2, a sequel to the 2022 shooter that looks to offer much of the same colorful, fast-paced action (and plenty of talking weapons, of course). It's coming this winter, and you'll be able to play it on day one with Game Pass.

Resonance: A Plague Tale Legacy looks very odd indeed

From Asobo Studio and Focus Entertainment comes Resonance: A Plague Tale Legacy, which is presumably some kind of Plague Tale spinoff. We didn't get too much on this one; just a cinematic trailer, a 2026 release window, and a lot of questions. Day one on Game Pass again!

A special Xbox ROG Ally is coming this holiday season

Oh, Xbox, you cheeky monkeys. Next up is an announcement for a special ROG Xbox Ally handheld, with an X variant also available with superior specs. Both consoles prominently show Hollow Knight: Silksong being played on them, because of course.

The Blood of Dawnwalker gets a spooky new trailer

Next, Rebel Wolves and Bandai Namco showed off The Blood of Dawnwalker, their upcoming vampiric action RPG. We got to see some suitably dark combat and traversal gameplay, but we didn't get a release date; just a 2026 release window.

Meat Boy returns in a 3D platforming extravaganza

Iconic platforming blob Meat Boy made a return in the next trailer, which eschews his usual hyper-masocore 2D trappings in favor of a 3D environment. It is, as you might expect, called Super Meat Boy 3D, and it's coming early next year.

Ninja Gaiden 4 gets a release date and an ultra-fast-paced trailer

If you were worried Ninja Gaiden 4 wouldn't offer the same ridiculously fast-paced action for which the series is known, today's trailer should have put your fears to rest. It's coming on October 21st.

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is getting story DLC

A brand new story expansion for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is on its way, and I for one am glad, because I can't get enough of that Troy Baker voice. The Order of Giants arrives on September 4th.

Game Freak reveals Beast of Reincarnation

Pokemon studio Game Freak making a Nier Automata-style action RPG wasn't on my bingo card, but there it is. Beast of Reincarnation is coming sometime next year.

Clockwork Revolution is another intriguing-looking action RPG

Next, inXile showed off its upcoming steampunk action RPG Clockwork Revolution, which looks like it'll combine the likes of Dishonored, BioShock, and Obsidian's own The Outer Worlds. You can play this one "in due time", so no release date, unfortunately.

Obsidian announces Grounded 2

Miniaturized survival game Grounded is getting a followup, Obsidian revealed during today's show. It's a very vibrant-looking survival game that's coming to Game Preview on July 29th, which ain't too far off at all.

Bloober Team's Cronos: The New Dawn scares up a storm this fall

If, like anyone else with taste, you were disappointed by The Callisto Protocol (sorry, fans), then Cronos: The New Dawn might be the antidote you've been waiting for. This Bloober Team survival horror game launches in fall.

Aphelion is a cinematic-looking adventure game from Don't Nod

Our next reveal was Aphelion, an adventure game from Don't Nod that looks like it owes more than a small debt to the likes of Uncharted and the newer Tomb Raider games. It's being made in collaboration with the European Space Agency, and it launches next year.

No Ghosts at the Grand is almost certainly lying to you

Next, it's a frankly bizarre-looking game (and I say that as a compliment) that appears to be one part renovation sim to one part spooky horror game and another part...er, reggae musical? It's definitely not a no from me. No Ghosts at the Grand launches next year as a day one Game Pass title.

Age of Mythology: Retold is getting Japanese gods in fall

More gods are on their way to Age of Mythology: Retold thanks to the Heavenly Spear DLC, which brings the ancient Japanese pantheon in fall. We got a glimpse of some iconic Japanese gods, like Yamata-no-Orochi, in the trailer.

Mudang: Two Hearts tackles a twisty-turny Korean story

Next up, we got a look at a brand new game by the name of Mudang: Two Hearts, and it looks like a pretty original prospect. Gameplay looks to be split between open-ended stealthy shooting and setpieces, but we'll get to find out when it launches in 2026.

Thunderful announces Planet of Lana 2: Children of the Leaf

Planet of Lana 2: Children of the Leaf is a followup to the 2023 cinematic platformer, and it'll return to the story of Lana and Mui, utilizing a very similar-looking visual and gameplay style to the original. It's coming next year, because of course it is.

Solo Leveling: Arise Overdrive brings the anime to life this year (and next)

Next, we got to see some suitably anime-looking gameplay for the action RPG Solo Leveling: Arise Overdrive, which comes to PC this year and to Xbox next year. It adapts the popular anime, so if you're a fan, it's safe to start getting excited.

Aniimo has very strong Palworld vibes, but without the guns

If you thought Palworld was perhaps a touch too edgy for your tastes (as I did), then Aniimo looks like it might be the game for you. It's got similar open-world Pokemon-style vibes, but without the guns and forced labor. It's coming in 2026.

Spiritfarer studio Thunder Lotus announces Fate's End

Fate's End is a brand new sidescroller from Spiritfarer studio Thunder Lotus, and it looks to marry that developer's love of hand-drawn art and storytelling with a more hands-on style reminiscent of Jotunn. This one launches...yup, you guessed it. Next year.

Persona 4 is absolutely getting that remake we all knew about

At this point, all that remained for Atlus was to make its Persona 4 remake official given comments made by certain voice actors, and the studio did exactly that in this show. It's called Persona 4 Revival, but we don't have a release date yet.

Invincible VS is a three-on-three tag fighter based on the comics

Next up, we got to see Skybound Games and Quarter Up's Invincible VS, a fighting game based on the comics (and the popular animated show) coming next year. It looks exactly as bloodily brutal as you'd expect.

Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade and XVI are coming to Xbox

Square Enix revealed that both Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade and Final Fantasy XVI will make their way to Xbox, with VII Remake coming this winter and XVI coming...well, today! You can pick the latter up right now. I'm not surprised the studio has made this decision.

Double Fine's next game lets you, er, play as a lighthouse

Well, I can't say it's ever been done before, at any rate. Double Fine announced its next game during the show, and you get to play as a rather adorable combination of a lighthouse and a scraggly-looking bird. Keeper launches on October 17th.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 is coming, and it looks trippy as heck

The final announcement during today's show was, of course, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, and it concludes with a confrontation between Black Ops 2 protagonist David Mason and Raul Menendez, with plenty of trippy-looking architecture and futuristic trappings to boot.

That's all for today! Make sure to check out our recaps for the main Summer Game Fest show and the PlayStation State of Play presentation that aired earlier this week if you want to catch up on this summer showcase period's news.

item.title: There Are No Ghosts At The Grand was a real highlight of tonight's Xbox showcase
item.content:encoded:
https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/there-are-no-ghosts-at-the-grand-was-a-real-highlight-of-tonights-xbox-showcase

All the clubs have been closed down

'Weird' is one of those words I try to avoid because it usually just means "I'm not going to even attempt to understand or unpack the specific thing this is going for", but supernatural hotel renovator There Are No Ghosts At The Grand really stood out to me this evening for a tone that felt pretty singular in a weekend weighed down by soulslikes and shooters. Broadly, it looks like your Powerwash Sims and House Flippers, but with the added wrinkle that neither of the games feature dapper old gents crooning ska ditties at you. Here's a trailer.

So, yeah: I'm into more or less everything here. The secrets and puzzles to solve between renovations. The ghostbustery multitool. The We Have The Specials At The Hotel soundtrack. The Wicker Man reference. The spiders stealing fire extinguishers and washing machines. It looks like a game with ideas, basically. And even if some those ideas are distinctly 'like that other thing', I dig the way they've been implemented. Also, one of those ideas is 'go for a motorbike ride with a cat'. Information's a bit scant on this one so far, but it's due for a release sometime next year.

item.title: Double Fine's next game looks gorgeous and is coming in October
item.content:encoded:
https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/double-fines-next-game-looks-gorgeous-and-is-coming-in-october

It's called Keeper and is about being a lighthouse

Double Fine's next game is called Keeper and it's about steering a four-legged lighthouse through a lush 3D world, with some puzzle-solving along the way. Its creation is being led by Lee Petty, who was previously project lead on Double Fine's RAD and Headlander. There's a trailer below, which also brings news that it won't be long before it releases.

Cor, it certainly looks nice, doesn't it?

The Xbox Wire post doesn't contain too much more information about what you do in the game beyond what's shown in the trailer. It does mention that the initial inspiration lay in the pandemic, the isolation of lockdowns and the escape offered by walks in nature near where director Lee Petty lived.

Double Fine are most closely associated with company founder Tim Schafer, the creative lead behind their point-and-click adventures and more recently Psychonauts 2. There are plenty of other creative leads at the studio though, and Alec and Sin previously enjoyed both Headlander and RAD in their respective reviews.

I don't need to know more. If it's fairly straightforward cinematic platforming in a world that looks like that, I think I'd be happy enough. And the release date - October 17th - doesn't leave much time left to wait.
